You give money to your friends and then they use it to go chase their dreams.

Ultimate win-win.

Irony of being openminded:

Everyone says they want leaders who are willing to change their mind when new information is presented, but many people get mad when the leaders actually change their mind.

It is hard to build things of value when you spend your time trying to tear down other people. 

Choose wisely.

Startups are outgunned in talent, capital, and awareness.

You only have your ideas and speed to fight back.

Think differently. Move quickly.

One of the most powerful things you can do at any point in your career is to find someone who has accomplished something you want to accomplish and then just ask them ‚Äúhow did you do it?‚Äù

As long as you avoid the pointless internet arguments with fools who are bored, debate is powerful tool.

The more you read books, listen to podcasts, Google questions, and ask experts to explain things, the more you learn.

It is 2023. You can learn anything.

I asked @yuris what are the common traits of the most successful founders in his experience. He said:

1. Bias towards action
2. Create velocity in the company
3. Scrappiness - do whatever it takes

Thought this was a great answer.

Everything you are doing today is practice for what you will do in the future.

This practice mentality will force you to document lessons learned as you go.
